Exercise 1.2-2

Suppose we are comparing implementations of insertion sort and merge sort on the same machine. For inputs of size n, insertion sort runs in 8n2 steps, while merge sort runs in 64nlgn steps. For which values of n does insertion sort beat merge sort

First of all, 8n2 < 64nlgn reduces to n < 8lgn. Next I used sort_compare.py to determine when insertion sort overtakes merge sort, which is at n = 43. (hilariously, this script wasnâ€™t doing what I wanted it to until I set n to start at 2 instead of 1)

sort_compare.py:

import math

n = 2
while True:
    if n < 8 * math.log2(n):
        print("for n = " + str(n) + ", merge sort beats insertion sort")
    else:
        print("for n = " + str(n) + ", insertion sort wins!")
        break
    n += 1
